entries.transcript: okay so um today i want to talk about the release plan for vox like what we ship first and what we cut
right so the bug is that the app records but sometimes the paste doesnt happen and i think its permissions but im not sure
we should probably add a small warning if the api key is missing and maybe say exactly which key not just missing key
entries.notes: Keep meaning and vocabulary; cleanup only.

entries.transcript: i tried it on bluetooth headphones and it sounded fine but the transcript had random commas and like weird capitalization
note to self check the pipeline timing logs encode stt rewrite paste and total and make sure they add up
the docs is out of date and we should update it before release
so basically the goal is fast rewrite no settings like the user should not choose models at all
i think we need retries on throttling but not infinite retries maybe exponential backoff with jitter
add a benchmark command that anyone can run with openrouter api key and it should output a markdown report
the app should never log actual transcript content in production logs just character counts
so ive been thinking about how the app feels slow and i think its not the stt anymore its the rewrite step because it waits for the llm and that can take like two seconds sometimes
entries.notes: Polish into clear prose; preserve intent.

entries.transcript: the problem with adding more settings is that it turns into a maze and then support becomes impossible so i want defaults that are just good
if we do a bakeoff we should measure p50 and p95 not just average because the long tail is what annoys users
for light cleanup it should mostly keep the same words but just fix punctuation and remove filler words like um and uh
we should pick the model that is fast and stable and then if quality is bad we roll back by changing the processing level defaults in one file
i want the report to be easy to scan like a table per level with latency and cost and pass rate and then a recommendation line
dont make this a big framework just a small executable that calls openrouter and writes json and markdown
entries.notes: Rewrite with good tone; preserve constraints.

entries.transcript: if a model is missing or errors out we should record that and still finish the run so we can see partial results
we should keep transcripts in the repo synthetic no user data and keep the corpus small enough that it doesnt cost much to run
after we pick new defaults we should update the docs and run strict build and strict tests so we dont break anything
i need you to review a swift file and point out bugs and missing tests and then suggest a safe refactor plan
entries.notes: Prompt enhancer: role, task, output format.

entries.transcript: help me write a script that runs swift build with warnings as errors and then swift test and fails fast if either one fails
i want a benchmark harness that tests rewrite latency across models and outputs a markdown report and a json artifact
act like a product engineer and propose a minimal rollback plan if users report the rewrite is worse after a model change
design a quality rubric for light aggressive and enhance rewrite modes but keep it simple and automatic no user settings
create a table that compares candidate openrouter models on latency cost and instruction following for transcript rewrite
i want you to update processing level default models based on benchmark results and also update the docs so they match
write a short methodology section for a benchmark report that explains corpus prompts quality gate and decision rules
help me add error handling so the benchmark can continue if one model fails and still record the failure in the results
give me a one command way to run the rewrite model benchmark locally and store the artifacts under docs performance
